content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
### Lab (Attempted) at position (0.5, 2.5)
• Intended as a research facility to receive Automation Science Packs.  
• Multiple attempts to place or craft the Lab have failed due to missing inventory and insufficient sub-ingredients.

### Iron Smelting Furnace at position (5.0, 5.0)
• Utilized for converting iron ore (with coal) into iron plates to support subsequent crafting attempts.

### Copper Smelting Furnace at position (-27.0, -60.0)
• Utilized for converting harvested copper ore (with coal) into copper plates needed for producing copper cables and other components.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Argument Mismatch (get_entities):
  – Use the correct parameter types when calling get_entities. Remove the unsupported keyword argument (e.g. “radius”) and verify that the number of positional arguments matches the API’s specification.

• Lab Placement Failure:
  – Confirm that a Lab is available in the inventory before attempting placement at (0.5, 2.5). Validate resource availability to meet all placement prerequisites.

• Iterating Over a None Value:
  – Check that get_entities returns a valid iterable. When a None value is possible, use a fallback (such as an empty list) before filtering or iteration.

• Insufficient Ingredient Errors for Lab Crafting:
  – Ensure all sub-ingredients (e.g. iron-gear-wheel, electronic-circuit, copper-cable) for Lab crafting are sufficiently stocked or producible.  
  – Pre-coordinate precursor production (including smelting and intermediate crafting) so that each required component is available prior to initiating Lab synthesis.

• Repeated Lab Crafting Failures:
  – Monitor critical resource counts and craft missing components ahead of time to avoid recurring shortages during Lab creation attempts.
